comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Hmm, where this comes from: Pinkey's blue book, or, The indigo agonies of a photographic amateur Johnston, Frances Benjamin, 1864-1952, photographer Date Created/Published: 1888 Nov. 2-Dec. 6. www.loc.gov/pictures/item/86707438/

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Everyone, Thanks for all the comments! It's a good suggestion that this unidentified man could be Theodore Roosevelt based on the location and his general appearance, but the date of the photograph doesn't support it, unfortunately. The date of this image has been determined to be 1888, based on Pinkey's Blue Book, as trialsanderrors points out. (Pinkey was a nickname for Frances Benjamin Johnston.) While this particular image is not part of Pinkey's Blue Book, you can see that the cover image was taken at the same time, and the book is dated to 1888 by the writing just below it. Theodore Roosevelt was appointed Assistant Secretary of the Navy in 1897 by President McKinley. In 1888, he was still living with his family at Sagamore Hill in Oyster Bay, New York.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Also, in the 1880s Teddy Roosevelt still looked noticeably younger than his well-known presidential self... www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2009633128/
